ygData.subject: Re: Banded Prices
ygData.msgSnippet: What some people don t understand is that, it may LOOK like they are making that big profit, but what about all the failures one went through to make that ONE
ygData.messageBody:
What some people don't understand is that, it may LOOK like they are making
that big profit, but what about all the failures one went through to make
that ONE suit of armor? And what about all the trouble he/she went to get
his/her skill high enough to make it? Are we just supposed to eat this
investment and say "I'm going to sell for a few gold above cost so I can
sell the most armor." Those who don't smith obviously don't understand
this. If this is the way it turns out, then I too will take up another
trade and make a whole lot more money with it than working my butt off at
the forge. I'd like to be able to afford that nice platemail armor before
I hit level 30, and smithing's not going to get me there if people expect
us to sell at a loss.

Zharkan -- Paladin of 18th
Average Smith
Master Potter
Master Brewer
